description: Unclear; probably related to Middle English sloor (“thin or fluid mud”); compare slur. From mid-15th c.

entries.meaning: Any flowable suspension of small particles in liquid.
examples: While little information is available, it[distillers wet yeast] probably is similar to spent brewers yeast slurry.

entries.meaning: (mining) Liquid waste from some types of mining, such as mountain top removal mining, usually very toxic and stored nearby in large dams.
examples: Slurry tailings ponds are by far the major type of containment facilities for slurry tailings.

entries.meaning: (agriculture) A mixture of animal waste, other organic material and sometimes water, stored in a slurry pit and used as fertilizer; also used in combination, as pig slurry, etc.
examples: In the Netherlands, the most problematic agricultural waste is liquid pig manure or pig slurry.

verbs.description: slurry (third-person singular simple present slurries, present participle slurrying, simple past and past participle slurried)

entries.meaning: To make a slurry (of some material).

examples: Next week we will be slurrying the parking lot.
He spoke with a slurry voice.
His voice became progressively slurrier as he drank the three bottles of wine.
